## Introduction

The Pacific Northwest is home to a wide variety of plants with medicinal, nutritional, and traditional uses. One such plant is the Northwest California Hazelnut, also known as Corylus cornuta var. californica. This plant has been used by indigenous peoples for centuries for its various benefits.

## Plant Overview

The Northwest California Hazelnut is a deciduous shrub that can grow up to 15 feet tall. It has smooth, grayish-brown bark and leaves that are dark green and oval-shaped. The plant produces small, round nuts that are enclosed in a leafy husk. These nuts are edible and have a rich, nutty flavor.

## Useful Properties

The Northwest California Hazelnut has several useful properties that make it valuable for medicinal and traditional uses. Some of these properties include:

- Antioxidant: The nuts of the plant are rich in antioxidants, which help protect the body against oxidative stress and damage caused by free radicals.
- Anti-inflammatory: The plant contains compounds that have anti-inflammatory properties, making it useful for reducing inflammation in the body.
- Nutritious: Hazelnuts are a good source of nutrients such as vitamin E, manganese, and healthy fats.

## Traditional and Medicinal Uses

The Northwest California Hazelnut has a long history of traditional and medicinal uses. Indigenous peoples in the Pacific Northwest have used various parts of the plant for different purposes. Some of these uses include:

- Food: The nuts of the plant are a nutritious food source and have been consumed by indigenous peoples for generations. They can be eaten raw, roasted, or used in cooking and baking.
- Medicine: The bark of the plant has been used to make a decoction that is believed to have medicinal properties. This decoction has been used to treat various ailments such as coughs, sore throats, and skin irritations.
- Basketry: The flexible branches of the plant have been used by indigenous peoples to make baskets, mats, and other woven items.

## Nutritional Benefits

The Northwest California Hazelnut is a nutritious plant that provides several health benefits. Some of the nutritional benefits of the plant include:

- Healthy Fats: Hazelnuts are rich in monounsaturated fats, which are heart-healthy fats that can help lower bad cholesterol levels.
- Vitamin E: The nuts are a good source of vitamin E, which is an antioxidant that helps protect cells from damage.
- Minerals: Hazelnuts contain minerals such as manganese, copper, and magnesium, which are important for various bodily functions.

## Practical Tips for Use

If you come across Northwest California Hazelnuts, here are some practical tips for using them:

- Harvesting: The nuts are ready for harvest when the husks turn brown and start to split. Collect the nuts and remove the husks before consuming or using them.
- Storage: Store the nuts in a cool, dry place to maintain their freshness and flavor. They can also be stored in the refrigerator or freezer to extend their shelf life.
- Culinary Uses: Hazelnuts can be used in a variety of culinary preparations, such as salads, desserts, and roasted snacks.

## Pro Tips

- Hazelnuts can be ground into a paste and used as a dairy-free alternative to butter or cream in recipes.
- Roasting hazelnuts intensifies their flavor and gives them a crunchy texture. To roast hazelnuts, spread them on a baking sheet and bake in a preheated oven at 350Â°F for about 10-15 minutes, or until they become golden brown.

## Summary

The Northwest California Hazelnut is a versatile plant with a range of medicinal, nutritional, and traditional uses. From its edible nuts to its medicinal bark, this plant has been valued by indigenous peoples for centuries. Whether used in cooking, medicine, or basketry, the Northwest California Hazelnut continues to be an important part of the Pacific Northwest's natural resources.
